summary:
• A group attempted to stage a coup in Bolivia.
• The attempt was unsuccessful within just 75 seconds.
• This highlights the resilience of the country's government and institutions during times of political unrest.

• A plane was diverted to Brazil due to severe turbulence that injured 30 people on board.
• The incident highlights concerns about air travel safety in turbulent weather conditions.
• An investigation is underway to determine the cause of the turbulence and ensure passenger safety in future flights.

• An Egyptian airline has apologized for leaving passengers in wheelchairs on the tarmac.
• The incident occurred when an airplane departed without the passengers being properly seated.
• The apology acknowledges the inconvenience caused to those affected.

• French political parties have launched a new campaign after the success of far-right candidates.
• Far-right candidate Jordan Bardella has become the face of the movement at just 28 years old.
• Voters are turning against President Macron's centrist policies, giving a boost to far-right candidates.

• A millionaire faces allegations regarding the Greek fires
• The individual claims to be surprised by these accusations
• Further details about the incident remain unclear

• Hungary is pushing against European Union norms with its "Make Europe Great Again" slogan.
• The country's hard-right stance contradicts EU values.
• This move puts Hungary at odds with its European partners.

• Medical Council of India to conduct NEET PG 2022 exam
• Students protest against the exam pattern
• Exam results will determine the future of aspiring Indian doctors

• In Egypt, Gaza evacuees live in the shadows.
• Iran has extended voting hours in its presidential elections.
• Everything is closing in on Gaza evacuees.

• The Director of Public Prosecutions has lodged an appeal against the leniency of the sentence handed down to an Irish soldier who assaulted another soldier
• This move comes after concerns were raised about the fairness of the initial sentence, which was deemed too light by many observers
• The appeal aims to ensure that justice is served in this high-profile case, sparking widespread interest among the public

• Israel orders Palestinians to leave southern Gaza area after rocket fire.
• Israel releases head of Gaza's al-Shifa hospital after seven months.
• Gaza's remaining hospitals will stop working in two days, health officials warn.

• The ongoing conflict between Lebanon and Israel has created an atmosphere of unease among citizens.
• Tensions remain high due to unresolved border disputes and military posturing.
• Escalation risks further destabilizing the region.

• Malawi's music industry has lost one of its most influential figures
• The musician dedicated his life to uplifting the lives of the marginalized through music
• His passing leaves a significant gap in Malawi's cultural landscape

• A North Korean family fled their country by hijacking a small fishing boat.
• The escapees were forced to navigate treacherous waters without proper equipment or supplies.
• After days at sea, they finally reached safety and shared their harrowing tale with the world.

• ANC loses majority but remains largest party
• Opposition parties gain seats amid dissatisfaction with ANC rule
• New government formed through coalition deal between ANC and opposition parties

• At least 9 people were killed
• A car plowed into a crowd
• Incident occurred in Seoul

• Taiwan is concerned about China's potential military aggression due to similarities with Russia's actions in Ukraine.
• Taiwan is increasing its defense capabilities through arms purchases and training exercises.
• Taiwan has strengthened diplomatic ties with countries that support its sovereignty amid rising tensions with China.

• Biden criticizes Trump for undermining the rule of law
• Biden's family supports his decision to continue in the White House race
• A judge releases Epstein transcripts unexpectedly
• A mistrial is declared for an American woman accused of murdering her boyfriend 
• The U.S. suspends aid to Gaza amid ongoing conflict
• Iran prepares for a presidential runoff election between a reformer and a conservative
• The U.S. seeks a peace agreement with Lebanon to prevent war
• Founder of Venezuela's most feared gang arrested
